metadata.title: CVE-2021-33061 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient control flow management for the Intel(R) 82599 EthernetControllers and Adapters may allow an authenticated user to potentiallyenable denial of service via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-125-generic - 5.4.0-125.141~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-125-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-125.141~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-125-lowlatency - 5.4.0-125.141~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-125-generic - 5.4.0-125.141~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-125-lowlatency - 5.4.0-125.141~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1084-aws - 5.4.0-1084.91~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1090-azure - 5.4.0-1090.95~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1087-gcp - 5.4.0-1087.95~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1082-oracle - 5.4.0-1082.90~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1069-raspi - 5.4.0-1069.79~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1032-ibm - 5.4.0-1032.36~18.04.1
No subscription required
